data.title: The Marriage Feast and Other Stories by Lagerkvist Par
data.meta_description: The Marriage Feast and Other Stories by Lagerkvist, Par and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Cloth. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Fair. None (illustrator). First edition. The first edition of this collection of stories from Par Lagerkvist. PÃ¤r Fabian Lagerkvist (23 May 1891 11 July 1974) was a Swedish author who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1951. In a navy cloth binding with original unclipped dustwrapper. Externally, generally smart. A few light marks and light shelfwear to the boards. Dustwrapper is sound, though with some loss and instances of foxing, and age-toning to the rear. Front endpaper has been removed. Internally, generally firmly bound. Pages are bright, though with some foxing. Good. book.

Hardback. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Second impression hardback, 1967, with unclipped jacket. In overall very good used condition with only slight signs of age, handling and storage. Internally clean. Binding tight and appears little read; no annotations or inscriptions; text bright and clear throughout. Not an old library book.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. F.EXELL (DUST JACKET ARTWORK) (illustrator). 1st Edition. Navy blue boards with gilt titles to spine, 210 x 145 mm approx. 222 pp. First UK Edition 1st impression 1955. Collection of short stories by the Swedish author who won the Nobel Prize for literature in 1951. Please see our images of the actual book offered for sale for further details and condition. VG/ VG (Book- no notable shelf wear or soiling, ink gift insc. to free front end paper. A little dust spotting to top edge with light foxing spots to same and other edges. Book block clean and binding sound. Dust Jacket - mild to moderate general shelf rubbing with a little loss to extremities- max 3 mm in depth, spine a little faded and light shelf soiling to white of rear panel. Non price clipped- cover 12/6. No in a removable proprietary protective sleeve).

VG+ with soiling to bottom edge in VG DJ with wear to extremities, chipping to head of edgeworn spine panel, some dust soiling and light age darkening to rear panel. Ink stains on ffep from previous owner's name, date and address which is inked on front pastedown.

Condition: Good. 1955. No edition remarks. 222 pages. Dust jacket over blue cloth. Clean pages with mild tanning to endpapers. Tightly bound with faint thumb-marking throughout. Pencil inscription to front endpaper. Boards have light shelf-wear with corner bumping. Mild sunning to spine and board edges. Mild crushing to spine ends. Books has a backward lean. Unclipped jacket has light edgewear with tears and creasing. Heavy tanning to spine and edges. Notable rubbing and marking all over.

Octavo, boards. First edition in English. "On the Scales of Osiris" was translated by Carl Eric Lindin, the remainder were translated by Alan Blair. At least one story is fantastic. "The Lift That Went Down into Hell" is termed a "disquieting fantasy" on the front jacket flap. A fine copy in near fine dust jacket with 10 mm closed tear at upper front spine fold, somewhat faded spine panel, and some general darkening to rear panel, mostly at flap fold. (#117618).
